content.description:
Follows the left most crack system beside "never again" / "Beach One". The climb starts with broken ledges and face moves and ventures into the clean-ish hand sized crack above.  Good hand jams lead through a steep section as the crack gets wider. There are loose blocks to the climbers right but these can be easily avoided. The crack comes to ledgy bit where climbers can traverse about 10 ft left into a hand and finger crack that continues upwards on easy terrain to the anchors above. This route was chosen as the rock directly above the first hand crack is loose and less desirable. There are many solid gear placement opportunities despite the broken nature of the crack. No runout required. This was recently cleaned as of Sept 2021, so it's still a little licheny on the face moves and the occasional loose rock remains. The FA was done with a 70m rope with some length to spare. If you're using a 60, terminate the end of the rope with a stopper knot. I think it should reach, but I did not measure it. You could likely meander to the "exit pitch" from the anchors if you wanted to also. Between "Bradycardia" and "Never Again". Leftmost crack beside "Never Again"  Trad: Cams from BD C4 0.5 - 3 (single rack or double up on the 2's and 3's.. even a 4 for the wide bit if you want to feel extra safe). Smaller gear towards the top and a couple decent nut placements.

Two bolts with rings at the anchor.

Awesome new route that gets progressively harder, High awkward first bolt.

Not yet in the free kamloops guidebook, awkward sloped belay, up the hill to the left of never again
Bolts, anchor chains

Some Loose rock, but good placements and solid holds are easy to find. Not as bad as the name would suggest. I would do it again. Shares an anchor with "Punch the Monkey" For topo's and detailed info climbkamloops.com gear and chain anchors
A fun crimpy slab leads up to a roof with a tricky pull over For topo's and detailed info climbkamloops.com bolts, chain anchors

Climb the crack and look for the anchors on top of the route to your left. Shares anchor with Never again, Punch the monkey and Static cling. For topo's and detailed info climbkamloops.com gear and chain anchors

With a fingery opening sequence climb up the wall passing the first bolt to betters holds at the second bolt. 
  
 Continue up the wall above on improving holds to fun moves at the overlap and then up to the anchors.

Right side of smooth face
bolts, double chain anchors
Awesome moves on vertical stone For topos and detailed info climbkamloops.com Bolts, anchor chains
Situated towards the far left end of the main area, this sector holds the hardest climb on the cliff and some other good climbs.   The climbs here are fairly short, with distinct cruxes.
